result.execSummary:
The defendant Drewveon Q Portis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: In the Wisconsin State Prison System
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
Comply with the standard rules of probation.
No contact with the victims, Keon P. and Brandon D., or the 4800 block of North 58th Street.  No contact with the co-actor, Antwan Green.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

Provide a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge; and pay the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  To be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court ordered restitution set at zero.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Drewveon Q Portis

records.addlTxt: Received & Filed, Original  PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (26 pages) commencing June 26, 2014 by Nancy Czerniejewski.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Drewveon Q Portis in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court heard sentencing recommendations.
Additional statements made by the defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:    The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS, with credit for 5 days time served.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR 6 MONTHS.  
Court finds the defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds the defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation under the supervision of the Wisconsin Department of Corrections for a period of 30 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
* Comply with the standard rules of probation.
* No contact with the victims, Keon P. and Brandon D., or the 4800 block of North 58th Street.
* No contact with the co-actor, Antwan Green.
* Perform 60 hours of community service.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.


Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.

Defendant Drewveon Q Portis in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form tendered to the Court.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Defendant Drewveon Q Portis in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Plea and Sentencing Hearing today, however, the parties are unable to proceed.
Judge Donald is currently in trial on an unrelated matter.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 06-26-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.

Defendant Drewveon Q Portis in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 05-29-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Keon P, Brandon D and Antwan G

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Drewveon Q Portis in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Drewveon Q Portis in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
